alert.note: Alert for Clay (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 7:43AM CDT until July 29 at 9:15AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Nebraska and south central Nebraska, including the following counties, in east central Nebraska, York. In south central Nebraska, Clay, Fillmore and Hamilton. * WHEN...Until 100 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 742 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area, in particular in the Sutton area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Geneva, Sutton, Henderson, Exeter, Fairmont, McCool Junction, Shickley, Milligan, Grafton, Ohiowa, Ong, Saronville, Stockham, Lushton and Strang. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
